top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
sounds like either way things are going in

Or use the straps inside the suitcase. Pack all of your clothes and shoes or toiletries so they fit in an even layer in the suitcase. Then dig the straps from below where your clothes are, wrap them around your items, clip them together, and tighten. Now you can add another layer of bonus items. 

For even more stability, place something large on top before clipping, like a sweatshirt or folded towel to stabilize the piles. Now your items will be in place when you arrive unless TSA fucks your shut up.
Also helps distribute the weight so it isn’t too heavy and fall over all the time

Prefer the closet size ziploc bags.

Vacuum or roll the air out.
